commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: Ifbc383f6d4c858189cee55e67b4d4274d9c3358a

commit_message:
DNM: increase swap to 4G

Default swap size is 1G.  We're hitting a lot of failures on the
cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job (and possibly others, but this is
the job where I've seen it a lot) with 500s from identity and
compute that may be due to mysqld crashing.  The memory-tracker
is showing 0 available space in swap, so let's bump it up and
see if that helps.

This patch runs *only* the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job
multiple times so we can get an idea of whether this works.

Change-Id: I2694ac66ac91ae06335c0dca1cdd64dc4c466065

commit_message:
DNM: increase swap to 2G

Default swap size is 1G.  We're hitting a lot of failures on the
cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job (and possibly others, but this is
the job where I've seen it a lot) with 500s from identity and
compute that may be due to mysqld crashing.  The memory-tracker
is showing 0 available space in swap, so let's bump it up and
see if that helps.

This patch runs *only* the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job
multiple times so we can get an idea of whether this works.

Change-Id: Iacdcee706679b96da8682269d6453c6fc383ea59

subject: DNM: use default swap size
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-12 21:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "DNM: use default swap size

We're hitting a lot of failures on the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest
job with 500s from identity and compute that may be due to mysqld
crashing while the memory-tracker shows 0 available space in swap.
Two patches to increase swap space (topic: increase-swap) seem to
be having success, but let's also run the job with the default
size to make sure the sudden success we're seeing isn't due to
some other factor.

This patch runs *only* the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job
multiple times so we can get an idea of what's going on.

Change-Id: I6062e94eec8d8f79921a27eb40d7a0c968182e16
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
DNM: use default swap size

We're hitting a lot of failures on the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest
job with 500s from identity and compute that may be due to mysqld
crashing while the memory-tracker shows 0 available space in swap.
Two patches to increase swap space (topic: increase-swap) seem to
be having success, but let's also run the job with the default
size to make sure the sudden success we're seeing isn't due to
some other factor.

This patch runs *only* the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job
multiple times so we can get an idea of what's going on.

Change-Id: I6062e94eec8d8f79921a27eb40d7a0c968182e16

commit_message:
[MariaDB] Fix ingress cluster role privileges

This patchset is adding update priviledge to ingress cluster role in order to let it to update mariadb state configmap. The problem appeared after upgrading nginx controller up to v1.1.3 in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I962ac336bf6b3588db88b04e2259de1aa20b1221

subject: Allow cinder v1/v2 endpoint creation if needed
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-04 17:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/templates/job-ks-service.yaml', 'cinder/Chart.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/cinder.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow cinder v1/v2 endpoint creation if needed

An earlier change [0] removed the older cinder v1 and v2 endpoint
definitions from values.yaml. If older APIs are required, they can be
enabled using overrides, but the ks-service job only creates a volumev3
endpoint.

This change updates the ks-service job to create all endpoints defined
in .Values.endpoints that have "volume" in their name. Note that several
settings are hardcoded to use volumev3, so this change would mostly
useful in enabling v2 in addition to v3.

0: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm/+/817310

Change-Id: I26594668ff26ed3f28e207f341b28a139b514e1c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow cinder v1/v2 endpoint creation if needed

An earlier change [0] removed the older cinder v1 and v2 endpoint
definitions from values.yaml. If older APIs are required, they can be
enabled using overrides, but the ks-service job only creates a volumev3
endpoint.

This change updates the ks-service job to create all endpoints defined
in .Values.endpoints that have "volume" in their name. Note that several
settings are hardcoded to use volumev3, so this change would mostly
useful in enabling v2 in addition to v3.

0: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm/+/817310

Change-Id: I26594668ff26ed3f28e207f341b28a139b514e1c

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-06 14:05:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix the import warning of secrets

openstack command gets the following warning:

  /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/barbicanclient/__init__.py:61: UserWarning:
  The secrets module is moved to barbicanclient/v1 directory, direct import of
  barbicanclient.secrets will be deprecated. Please import barbicanclient.v1.secrets
  instead.

To fix that, import secrets from barbicanclient.v1 as the warning indicates.

Change-Id: Ib6548cfe30ce407f349cdeebec9a67e22a31bc74
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-05-16 21:02:55.000000000', 'files': ['barbicanclient/barbican_cli/v1/secrets.py'], 'message': 'Fix the import warning of secrets

openstack command gets the following warning:

  /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/barbicanclient/__init__.py:61: UserWarning:
  The secrets module is moved to barbicanclient/v1 directory, direct import of
  barbicanclient.secrets will be deprecated. Please import barbicanclient.v1.secrets
  instead.

To fix that, import secrets from barbicanclient.v1 as the warning indicates.

Change-Id: Ib6548cfe30ce407f349cdeebec9a67e22a31bc74
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix the import warning of secrets

openstack command gets the following warning:

  /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/barbicanclient/__init__.py:61: UserWarning:
  The secrets module is moved to barbicanclient/v1 directory, direct import of
  barbicanclient.secrets will be deprecated. Please import barbicanclient.v1.secrets
  instead.

To fix that, import secrets from barbicanclient.v1 as the warning indicates.

Change-Id: Ib6548cfe30ce407f349cdeebec9a67e22a31bc74

commit_message:
Add the dbus-tools package to manila-share image

If configuring manila-share with the Ceph-via-NFS
driver, the service communicates with the NFS-Ganesha
gateway via DBUS [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html#deployment-considerations

Change-Id: I310a3c766ec81caa04748ea6f62523e8c9678d55
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4248a3b4a62197f8014966474739c79c19f0de2f)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I408636cecfe533fc1b85cd0621421fbc637634d0

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

This patch also fixes a broken test by updating the maximum
payload size to match the current maximum in Barbican. [3]

This patch also skips an additional broken test.  It will be
fixed in a separate patch.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/src/branch/stable/yoga/barbican/common/config.py#L33

Change-Id: Id192b8eef2c2518b8a89f200727bd03c47dbd07e
(cherry picked from commit 8e3a391fd63c0a319071fc55996faab3e6699a0f)

commit_message:
[stable-only] Enable manila api policy configuration

Introduce a THT parameter (which is being used in [1])
in the manila api manifest to allow overriding API RBAC
policies. This change exists in master [2], but is part
of a bigger patch to fix service policy plumbing into horizon.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/60d9d5278208967084d1a642ba6cdd6a438df04c/environments/enable-secure-rbac.yaml#L3137
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/823891

Change-Id: I00b04b7acf50e8f99d6c0c9a41ef4691e53f0b02
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-23 18:32:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP Refactor rate-limiting helper into a class

TODO:
* add unit tests for RateLimiter
* add unit test for the deprecation warning

Replaces the ratelimit_sleep helper function with a RateLimiter class
that encapsulates the rate-limiting state that previously needed to be
maintained by the caller of the function.

The ratelimit_sleep function is retained but deprecated, and now
forwards to the RateLimiter class.

The object updater's BucketizedUpdateSkippingLimiter is refactored to
take advantage of the new RateLimiter class.

Change-Id: Ibcf4dbeb4332dee7e9e233473d4ceaf75a5a85c7
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2022-05-04 13:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'swift/container/updater.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'swift/obj/auditor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'swift/common/db_auditor.py'], 'message': "Refactor rate-limiting helper into a class

Replaces the ratelimit_sleep helper function with an
EventletRateLimiter class that encapsulates the rate-limiting state
that previously needed to be maintained by the caller of the function.

The ratelimit_sleep function is retained but deprecated, and now
forwards to the EventletRateLimiter class.

The object updater's BucketizedUpdateSkippingLimiter is refactored to
take advantage of the new EventletRateLimiter class.

The rate limiting algorithm is corrected to make the allowed request
rate more uniform: previously pairs of requests would be allowed in
rapid succession before the rate limiter would the sleep for the time
allowance consumed by those two requests; now the rate limiter will
sleep as required after each allowed request. For example, before a
max_rate of 1 per second might result in 2 requests being allowed
followed by a 2 second sleep. That is corrected to be a sleep of 1
second after each request.

Change-Id: Ibcf4dbeb4332dee7e9e233473d4ceaf75a5a85c7
", 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Refactor rate-limiting helper into a class

Replaces the ratelimit_sleep helper function with an
EventletRateLimiter class that encapsulates the rate-limiting state
that previously needed to be maintained by the caller of the function.

The ratelimit_sleep function is retained but deprecated, and now
forwards to the EventletRateLimiter class.

The object updater's BucketizedUpdateSkippingLimiter is refactored to
take advantage of the new EventletRateLimiter class.

The rate limiting algorithm is corrected to make the allowed request
rate more uniform: previously pairs of requests would be allowed in
rapid succession before the rate limiter would the sleep for the time
allowance consumed by those two requests; now the rate limiter will
sleep as required after each allowed request. For example, before a
max_rate of 1 per second might result in 2 requests being allowed
followed by a 2 second sleep. That is corrected to be a sleep of 1
second after each request.

Change-Id: Ibcf4dbeb4332dee7e9e233473d4ceaf75a5a85c7

commit_message:
Disables optimistic pa in Maridb Config
Per:
https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-22766

1) if cert.optimistic_pa=NO Mariadb pods can be
restarted without any issue.
2) Mariadb can be upgraded from 10.2.x to 10.4.x and
conditionally set cert.optimistic_pa=NO for 10.4.x
only. cert.optimistic_pa=false is not support for
10.2.x and 10.2.x will not start if the option is set
3) This patchset was tested by upgrading Mariadb
from version 10.2.32 to 10.4.17

Change-Id: I2f5ba7a443557019d5c594cbedea4ea5907195db

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2021-08-15 14:06:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix(neutron): exclude 127.0.0.1 from tunnel ip detection

commit_message:
fix(neutron): exclude 127.0.0.1 from tunnel ip detection

The tunnel ip detection script includes 127.0.0.1 as a valid option
when selecting the tunnel IP addresses. This causes issues when using
anycast addresses on the loopback interface.

This change excludes 127.0.0.1 from the selection so only other
addresses remain. This should not cause issues for existing users
as it's not possible to setup VXLAN tunnels to other nodes when
using 127.0.0.1 as tunnel endpoint.

Change-Id: I9800120f58376c755e666a77f0bf5476d9d9337e

commit_message:
Enable issuer usage for public ingresses

Now internal ingress only uses cert issuer and public ingresses only
use manual cert injection.
But there is a case using letsencrypt issuer so we can publish valid
cert for public ingresses also.

Change-Id: I89f3bb88f4387b315e57552712eae1922a4afd84

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8863, 'name': 'Andrii Ostapenko', 'email': 'anost1986@gmail.com', 'username': 'aostapenko'}, {'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 28235, 'name': 'Aaron Sheffield', 'email': 'ajs@sheffieldfamily.net', 'username': 'aaronsheffield'}, {'_account_id': 30745, 'name': 'Kelly Carter', 'email': 'KC755D@att.com', 'username': 'kc755d'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-21 23:17:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow for dyanmic ks-user-job name

In the scenario of a helm chart which will be used by multiple armada charts,
this means that we will have overlapping Kubernetes resources in the same namespace.
To avoid issues and keep the resources attached to their specific armada chart (release),
we need the names of each resource to be:
    {{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }}.
Now, in using the ks-user job, the name is set to:
    name: {{ printf "%s-%s" $serviceUserPretty "ks-user" | quote }}
^ $serviceUserPretty is just $serviceUser replacing “_”:
    {{- $serviceUserPretty := $serviceUser | replace "_" "-" -}}

So if we want the name to be unique ({{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }})
we have to send this in as $serviceUser …
The issue comes up when ks-user-job grabs values from values.yaml like so:
envAll.Values.secrets.identity $serviceUser
envAll.Values.endpoints.identity.auth $serviceUser

Now our values.yaml HAS to be overridden in every armada chart to solve this AND
it will fail helm lint, because who knows when you do a helm lint what you need to
put in the values.yaml when it generates a unique release name??

We want more flexibility in the ks-user-job, to not basically use one parameter for everything, and
allow simple use by adding another parameter so we don't have to override value in values.yaml
and can pass helm linting (side effect of needing specific values in values.yaml).

Change-Id: I6758cefbb17e369d3a39f812d63bd487a08f47f0

commit_message:
Allow for dynamic ks-user-job name

In the scenario of a helm chart which will be used by multiple armada
charts, this means that we will have overlapping Kubernetes resources
in the same namespace.
To avoid issues and keep the resources attached to their specific armada
chart (release), we need the names of each resource to be:
    {{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }}.
Now, in using the ks-user job, the name is set to:
    name: {{ printf "%s-%s" $serviceUserPretty "ks-user" | quote }}
^ $serviceUserPretty is just $serviceUser replacing “_”:
    {{- $serviceUserPretty := $serviceUser | replace "_" "-" -}}

So if we want the name to be unique ({{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }})
we have to send this in as $serviceUser …
The issue comes up when ks-user-job grabs values from values.yaml:
envAll.Values.secrets.identity $serviceUser
envAll.Values.endpoints.identity.auth $serviceUser

Now our values.yaml HAS to be overridden in every armada chart to solve
this AND it will fail helm lint, because who knows when you do a helm
lint what you need to put in the values.yaml when it generates a unique
release name.

We want more flexibility in the ks-user-job, to allow for the name to be
unique (based of release) while not having to override values in
values.yaml and also pass helm linting (side effect of needing specific
values in values.yaml).

Change-Id: I6758cefbb17e369d3a39f812d63bd487a08f47f0

subject: Fix problems in commit 'Realize libvirt SSL'
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-29 04:01:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix problems in commit 'Realize libvirt SSL'

1. Put clientkey.pem in the / etc/pki/libvirt/private directory.
2. The value of the configuration item 'listen_tcp' should be '1',
otherwise nova-compute will not be connected to libvirt.
3. '_ tls_volume.tpl' does not support parameters' path', 'certs'.

commit_message:
Fix problems in commit 'Realize libvirt SSL'

1. Put clientkey.pem in the /etc/pki/libvirt/private directory.
2. The value of the configuration item 'listen_tcp' should be '1',
otherwise nova-compute could not  connect to libvirt.
3. '_ tls_volume.tpl' does not support parameters 'path', 'certs'.

Change-Id: I775e1c57ca31bfb2067d4a3e8110a0b73f955908

commit_message:
[nova] Use HostToContainer mount propagation where possible

HostToContainer is preferred (over Bidirectional) in places it can be
used safely.

Change-Id: I6fed319b4acacdb1b8bdc973e7152e8cc2af5fa3

commit_message:
Fix virtualenv version comparison in setup_pip.sh

Also remove special logic for pip>=20 since it's not compatible with pip>20.3

commit_message:
Enable probes override from values.yaml for libvirt

  This PS enables overriding liveness/readiness probes configurations
for libvirt pods via values.yaml.

Change-Id: I64033a1d67461851d8f2d86905ef7068c2ec43b6

Select Leader node optimization

If you use hostNetwork and the hostname does not contain the character "-", an error will be reported here.

commit_message:
Fix job-bootstrap ClusterRole name

Change the serviceAccountName value, which is used to ClusterRole name, in order to be able to deploy multiples nova charts in different kubernetes namespace

subject: Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Cinder
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-21 09:34:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for PostgreSQL

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Change-Id: I2900701d45c141867929370957c7acde47969acc

commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Cinder

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: I2900701d45c141867929370957c7acde47969acc

commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Horizon

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: Iec6045b8c4cd45c22d49be27da2dc6189dd5358e

commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Heat

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: Ifead1cefd42bb3fcb262b405316b49eae5d00339

commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Nova

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: Iae43edf23e9e044d38e98838602d43416efdd112

commit_message:
Remove create_floating_ip & get_server_ip methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Barbican tempest plugin still uses nova-network old interface for floating ip related methods, this patch removes them and use tempests's ones which already use neutron's interface.[2]

Replaced methods:
	* create_floating_ip
	* get_server_ip

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6428139de18291c916852ae48130fb8a7b4db318

Change-Id: I2f6b61d868f9fc68cf000627a5a905083af6ace7

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I16ea0a61c018d03d6c23e0b0736295a36b6dd367

commit_message:
Iptables rule for geneve traffic should match UNTRACKED state

In the raw table we are explicity set Geneve traffic to be not tracked
by conntrack. Because of that we should later in the filter table match
on the UNTRACKED geneve traffic instead of NEW.

Closes-Bug: #1972283
Change-Id: If744e35d4c0286a50ccf0220c122f8355d5833f2

commit_message:
Make bootstrap tasks more modular

To avoid calling the same tasks multiple times,
this change splits out the packages component.
This allows us to call it from other tasks without
running the entire role

Change-Id: Ifc38772898e864af9c76d45e87b34e4390bfd033

We observe excessive DB calls to load DistributedPortBindings,
We have enabled DVR and have some huge virtual routers with around
60 router interfaces scheduled on around 200 compute nodes. Under such
situation, subquery load DistributedPortBinding looks like not a very wise
idea, because it is not explicitly used.

I glance through the code and have a feeling that ml2_distributed_port_bindings
is not used except explicitly gets casued. So IMO it is save to change it to
default lazy model without causing serious regression.

Change-Id: Ib2c48bd5ad55e9c754a8e4938e6c5eafacc75dcc

commit_message:
Do not auto subquery load DistributedPortBindings

We observe excessive DB calls to load DistributedPortBindings,
We have enabled DVR and have some huge virtual routers with around
60 router interfaces scheduled on around 200 compute nodes. Under such
situation, subquery load DistributedPortBinding looks like not a very wise
idea, because it is not explicitly used.

I glance through the code and have a feeling that ml2_distributed_port_bindings
is not used except explicitly called. So IMO it is safe to change it to
default lazy load without causing serious regression.

Closes-bug: #1973576
Change-Id: Ib2c48bd5ad55e9c754a8e4938e6c5eafacc75dcc

commit_message:
Allow to filter multiple tags for image list

Currently in case of passing `--tag` several times, only last one will
be picked up for the filtering. In the meanwhile Glance allow option to
be repeated multiple times to filter based on the multiple tags.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/789827
Change-Id: I7379d0b0014f0e3d13b02ee5ec6b642a7a5aa7d1

commit_message:
Set volume/build_timeout for zuul jobs

The default in tempest is 196, and we're seeing backup test failures
where the backup completes shortly after that.  So increase it to
300 in the  cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-barbican-base-abstract job,
which should propagate it out to most of the other jobs.

Change-Id: I87c0669e91ba49a66a48b0722fcf140091f6b19f

commit_message:
Make U content-provider & V upgrades voting again

In patch[1], we marked Ussuri content-provider and Victoria
upgrade jobs non-voting because Ussuri content-provider was
down because of quay.ceph.io outage.

Removing voting:false as Ussuri content-provider is back
after quay.ceph.io restoration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/841549

Related-Bug: #1973115
Change-Id: I9bde591cd2cd3f8133189ec238106a6e31af4d27

subject: Increase swap size to 4GB
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-14 16:31:08.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Increase swap size to 4GB

The ceph jobs are failing apparently due to mysqld being reaped by
the oom reaper, which of course cascades into service failures due
to db errors.  Increasing the swap size allows the jobs to run to
completion.

Default is 1G.  See other patches on topic: increase-swap to see
how 4G was determined.

Change-Id: Ibf2a7fd2a305d04303b1288a6f1faebfc9ffd6de
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Increase swap size to 4GB

The ceph jobs are failing apparently due to mysqld being reaped by
the oom reaper, which of course cascades into service failures due
to db errors.  Increasing the swap size allows the jobs to run to
completion.

Default is 1G.  See other patches on topic: increase-swap to see
how 4G was determined.

Change-Id: Ibf2a7fd2a305d04303b1288a6f1faebfc9ffd6de

commit_message:
Added tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone-standard parent

Reparenting tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone jobs,
Now scenario jobs directly parent with
tripleo-ci-base-standalone-standard job, it will
completely remove multiparenting from scenario jobs.

CS parenting structure:
* tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone-standard
** tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario0XX-standalone
** tripleo-ci-centos-9-scenario0XX-standalone

Moved all files (Trigger files), vars, featureset under job:
- tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone-standard

Branches, Release, nodeset handeled by:
- tripleo-ci-centos-{8,9}-scenario0XX-standalone

Change-Id: Ib57afbac86afa29a4897682b094c8f593b5ccf45
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ensure each host is type string

ssh_servers takes a list of strings. This change
ensures that each item in the list is a string
instead of type Host being returned from
InventoryManager.

Resolves: rhbz#2085492
Change-Id: Ic3dc6304287361e83e91ad05aa480ff874011f1b

subject: Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

payload size to match the current maximum in Barbican. [3]

This patch also skips an additional broken test.  It will be
fixed in a separate patch.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/src/branch/stable/yoga/barbican/common/config.py#L33

Change-Id: Id192b8eef2c2518b8a89f200727bd03c47dbd07e
', 'number': 6}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

This patch also fixes a broken test by updating the maximum
payload size to match the current maximum in Barbican. [3]

This patch also skips an additional broken test.  It will be
fixed in a separate patch.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/src/branch/stable/yoga/barbican/common/config.py#L33

Change-Id: Id192b8eef2c2518b8a89f200727bd03c47dbd07e

subject: Increase swap size to 4GB
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-13 16:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Increase swap size to 4GB

This is to address issues in the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest* jobs
where a significant number of builds are failing.  Symptoms are a
lot of server fault errors, identity error: unexpected status
code 500, and db connection errors in the tempest log.  On these
jobs, syslog shows multiple
   oom_reaper: reaped process xxxxxxx (mysqld)
lines.  Occasionally ceph-osd or ceph-mons are also reaped, but
it's pretty consistently mysqld.

Default swap size is currently 1G.  Increase to 4GB was determined
experimentally.  (See other patches on topic: increase-swap.)

Change-Id: I3c08f363f5b74e1fe7900f4398bd2cb6df3a80d7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Increase swap size to 4GB

This is to address issues in the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest* jobs
where a significant number of builds are failing.  Symptoms are a
lot of server fault errors, identity error: unexpected status
code 500, and db connection errors in the tempest log.  On these
jobs, syslog shows multiple
   oom_reaper: reaped process xxxxxxx (mysqld)
lines.  Occasionally ceph-osd or ceph-mons are also reaped, but
it's pretty consistently mysqld.

Default swap size is currently 1G.  Increase to 4GB was determined
experimentally.  (See other patches on topic: increase-swap.)

Change-Id: I3c08f363f5b74e1fe7900f4398bd2cb6df3a80d7

commit_message:
Add the dbus-tools package to manila-share image

If configuring manila-share with the Ceph-via-NFS
driver, the service communicates with the NFS-Ganesha
gateway via DBUS [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html#deployment-considerations

commit_message:
Limit pyroute2 to be <=0.6.5

[1] limited pyroute to be lower or equal than 0.6.6 to avoid new
exception NetlinkDumpInterrupted, but it badly read which pyroute
releases contain this new feature with the above exception.
So go down one more verison of pyroute to 0.6.5 and below.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/833025
Related-Bug: #1962608

Change-Id: I35e6215ccb407da6a8d23f8e7bd2f8a0e779fe2c

commit_message:
Update devstack-heat

This useful tool was outdated and written really clumsily. This commit
rewrites bash code to Python, adds options like peeking stack.sh logs,
deploying from a commit or branch and fixes deploying from a gerrit
change.

Change-Id: Icaa01d660b2cdf376d6f000230114986a454c4fb

commit_message:
[Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules

In rare scenarios, an access rule known to manila may
be missing from CephFS. The driver shouldn't raise an
exception when this happens.

Change-Id: Iaeb84f1d9f4c04c23f470ad777d7d6cf2455f543
Closes-Bug: #1971530
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74e1fe4761b3bc4efb9a60d1b2887766c9ce43a9)
(cherry picked from commit a607ed8e999209f8a369f05191a0490ca426f4d6)
(cherry picked from commit 8805f4f3da2d474b5620f1e9d94eb984e3897db0)

commit_message:
Preserve local mirrors when using Ubuntu element

Cloud-init overwrites sources.list on boot. This causes issues when using
locally-defined or other repositories in a custom sources.list file.
This change adding a script and a DIB arg to the Ubuntu element adds
the configuration necessary to prevent this behaviour.

Change-Id: I29d0afbe612f827dfbc7c5266e2873918a09cf6f

commit_message:
Fix Ocata series state

Ocata went to End of Life several months ago [1], but it took time to
transition all the projects and it was forgotten to mark Ocata series
status as EOL. This patch corrects now Ocata status.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/022989.html

Change-Id: I7a5f71c731d9ad6e423e70c03210814d273a9974

commit_message:
Normalize the server_addr dashboard backend

The server_addr dashboard backend should be the same argument used as
instance of the current ceph-mgr container running on a controller node.
Due to a recent change in pacific the container name and the ceph-mgr
instance are not consistent anymore, and the purpose of this patch is to
rework the way this info is retrieved from ceph.

Closes-Bug: #1972729
Change-Id: Ifc9a0a9ac2f13c891ccde826aef2ab7cbdb5d690

baremetal: refactor docker deployment into a separate role

The multitude of set_fact tasks have been replaced with task variables.

The deprecated docker_custom_option variable has been removed.

subject: ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-28 10:03:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ovn make  ovn-openflow-probe-interval as value ajustable

to improve for performance issues the inactivity probe interval ajustable
of the OpenFlow connection to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds.
If the value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive feature.
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-05-05 10:13:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  fea‐
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

The value is set to 60 seconds by default as described in
"OVN issues in the field".

https://www.openvswitch.org/support/ovscon2019/day1/1436-OVSCON-Nouman.pdf
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2022-05-12 09:29:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  fea‐
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

commit_message:
ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  fea‐
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

The value is set to 60 seconds by default as described in
"OVN issues in the field".

https://www.openvswitch.org/support/ovscon2019/day1/1436-OVSCON-Nouman.pdf
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405

commit_message:
Add doc fix for all-in-one in venv

When running in virtual environment a bootstrapping task will
install 'docker' python module in the environment. After that
prechecks and deploy phase will not find the module because
their 'ansible interpreter' is host wide. With this fix it is
advised to set an interpreter to the one in virtual environment

Closes-Bug: #1969812
Change-Id: I1bb6a3af3fa6346fff0a262e0c53d12c544f46db
(cherry picked from commit 5bcf5391bc81c2eadfc24a619691316c02554f73)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-11 11:52:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-05-12 11:01:47.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py'], 'message': "Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383

commit_message:
Add package-upgrade action

The package-upgrade action performs package upgrades for the current
OpenStack release.

The code path used is similar to the openstack-upgrade action, with the
difference being that package-upgrade will not execute if an openstack
upgrade is available (based on the openstack-origin setting).

This change includes a charm-helpers sync.

Change-Id: I88ccffad7af2d2e9cddc1f6514ebd07898e117dc

subject: Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-06 20:28:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning

At the moment, if libvirt times out in detaching a device, it
reports this as an ERROR even if the process will be retried
and eventually succeed.

We should just log a warning since there's nothing to do, and
if the process fails after all the retries, it will log an ERROR
anyways.

Change-Id: Idda12db5758706a97b7841571b9ecd3dc6e6905e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-05-06 20:31:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning

At the moment, if libvirt times out in detaching a device, it
reports this as an ERROR even if the process will be retried
and eventually succeed.

We should just log a warning since there's nothing to do, and
if the process fails after all the retries, it will log an ERROR
anyways.

Closes-Bug: #1972023
Change-Id: Idda12db5758706a97b7841571b9ecd3dc6e6905e
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning

At the moment, if libvirt times out in detaching a device, it
reports this as an ERROR even if the process will be retried
and eventually succeed.

We should just log a warning since there's nothing to do, and
if the process fails after all the retries, it will log an ERROR
anyways.

Closes-Bug: #1972023
Change-Id: Idda12db5758706a97b7841571b9ecd3dc6e6905e

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], dropping
the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Co-Authored-By: Manpreet Kaur <kaurmanpreet2620@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iff303aee59ca9232e10e41d478f04abb085b9051

commit_message:
Remove release names starting from 2023.1 release

It was discussed in the April 2022 PTG [1] and finally it was decided
that release names, even they are good from the marketing point of view,
makes a lot of troubles every cycle to choose something which would be
appropropriate for everyone.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L265

Change-Id: I1eee82afaa20a06bd1a2d0b4b0886e5c2cd44545

After closing the story board [1] the api won't return deleted

causes confusion as it always return an empty result.

Change-Id: I6299c5fed2140b7df1713da798103ade54ec517b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove DELETED from the provisioning status list

After closing the story board [1] the api won't return deleted
records. Leaving the 'DELETED' on the '--provisioning-status' list
causes confusion as it always return an empty result.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1673504

Change-Id: I6299c5fed2140b7df1713da798103ade54ec517b

commit_message:
Don't create ironic_tftp_master_path directory, change default

This will be created by ironic on startup. Not creating it here is
consistent with the move to have ironic be responsible for its own
setup/config where possible.

This commit also changes the bifrost default ironic_tftp_master_path
of /var/lib/ironic/master_images to the ironic [pxe]tftp_master_path
default of /tftpboot/master_images. This fixes a permission denied
issue when selinux is enforcing, since dnsmasq cannot access image
files with type var_lib_t.

Change-Id: I54c2f3ed417156d0130eb0e5b400cfc2a09b51fc

commit_message:
Dropped the python 3.6/3.7 in zed cycle testing runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Ic8cf4bf0ba12043d15e1ff31832f42cc14b3e021

subject: Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 03:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Idd51e189d7e8dc5626a831c06a5a47ae5a11f5f7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Idd51e189d7e8dc5626a831c06a5a47ae5a11f5f7

subject: Update auth_openidc_module path
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-14 13:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openidc.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Update auth_openidc_module path

While using relative path in order to specify auth_openidc_module
path it seems to be relativ to the ServerRoot dir. Hence the module
is not loaded and Apache2 fail to start. Using an absolute path
works fine.
apache2 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-auth-openidc 2.4.1-1

Change-Id: I19cacd525fc4da3737ac0b3eec921d411164c524
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update auth_openidc_module path

While using relative path in order to specify auth_openidc_module
path it seems to be relativ to the ServerRoot dir. Hence the module
is not loaded and Apache2 fail to start. Using an absolute path
works fine.
apache2 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-auth-openidc 2.4.1-1

Change-Id: I19cacd525fc4da3737ac0b3eec921d411164c524

commit_message:
WIP: Move common settings out of api class and into init

Current setup isn't usable if you have different hosts running
api and worker. Also bring it more into line with other
puppet modules.

Change-Id: I0dacf7d0e36426dd6b2d2239dceeb11c45be9bd9
TODO: tests, backwards compat

subject: Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 12670, 'name': 'Helen Walsh', 'email': 'helen.walsh@emc.com', 'username': 'walshh2'}, {'_account_id': 13425, 'name': 'Simon Dodsley', 'email': 'simon@purestorage.com', 'username': 'sdodsley'}, {'_account_id': 16721, 'name': 'Zohar Mamedov', 'email': 'zohar.cloud@gmail.com', 'username': 'zohar'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27615, 'name': 'Rajat Dhasmana', 'email': 'rajatdhasmana@gmail.com', 'username': 'whoami-rajat'}, {'_account_id': 33431, 'name': 'Fábio Oliveira', 'email': 'fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com', 'username': 'fabiooliveira1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-27 13:14:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error

As part of the effort agreed in the last PTG to simplify and properly
define the driver interface this patch consolidates methods do_setup and
check_for_setup_error in a single method called setup.

The reason to consolidate both methods is that they are always called
one right after the other, os there was no real reason to force the
drivers to split things in a particular way.

This patch provides a basic backward compatible "setup" implementation
that calls "do_setup" and "check_for_setup_error" if they exist.

We could just update the base driver and interface classes, but then we
risk new driver implementations using existing driers as reference and
perpetuating the split of the methods, so the patch actually
consolidates the methods for most (not all) of the drivers.

To avoid getting docstrings from the driver and the interface (which is
the one used for the documentation) out of sync we replace the
description on cinder/volume/driver.py with a text referencing the
interface docstring.

Change-Id: Icdbcae7cf9644ff9c21712df6cc66dc64f7e9556
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2021-10-28 07:53:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error

commit_message:
Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error

As part of the effort agreed in the last PTG to simplify and properly
define the driver interface this patch consolidates methods do_setup and
check_for_setup_error in a single method called setup.

The reason to consolidate both methods is that they are always called
one right after the other, as there was no real reason to force the
drivers to split things in a particular way.

This patch provides a basic backward compatible "setup" implementation
that calls "do_setup" and "check_for_setup_error" if they exist.

We could just update the base driver and interface classes, but then we
risk new driver implementations using existing drivers as reference and
perpetuating the split of the methods, so the patch actually
consolidates the methods for most (not all) of the drivers.

To avoid getting docstrings from the driver and the interface (which is
the one used for the documentation) out of sync we replace the
description on cinder/volume/driver.py with a text referencing the
interface docstring.

Depends-On: Id037c1b8a570eea704c136f35ac0b262ca5b0dfa
Change-Id: Icdbcae7cf9644ff9c21712df6cc66dc64f7e9556

commit_message:
[L3HA] Don't update HA router's ports if router isn't active on agents

In case when HA router isn't active on any L3 agent,
_ensure_host_set_on_port method shouldn't try to update port's host to
the host from which there was an rpc message sent, as this can be host
on which router is in the "standby" mode.
This method should only update port's host to the router's "active_host"
if there is such active_host found already.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/841489

Closes-Bug: #1973162
Closes-Bug: #1942190
Change-Id: Ib3945d294601b35f9b268c25841cd284b52c4ca3

commit_message:
Fix malformed OIDCMemCacheServers

Change from comma separated list of memcache servers to space separated list.
Comma seperated list results in a 500 error response.
Upstream docs state this should be space separated and can be found here:
https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf#L629-L631

Closes-Bug: #1972033
Change-Id: Ibaef3672c656213dd5ba1488379d686130e041c5

commit_message:
Save COMPOSE_ID info after setting up repos

This patch adds a command to save current COMPOSE_ID configured in the
mirrors at the moment that the job is being executed.
This information can be useful when comparing new failures with previous
success or failed jobs.

Change-Id: I804f4ae26846734f6e182da9c44ff77426dabce4
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

during Victoria and was removed during Wallaby. Now Manila always
enables snapshot support for CephFS backend. Following that deprecation
in Manila, the corresponding parameter of puppet-manila was deprecated

commit_message:
Deprecate ineffective ManilaCephFSCephFSEnableSnapshots

The cephfs_enable_snapshots parameter was deprecated in Manila[1]
during Victoria and was removed during Wallaby. Now Manila always
enables snapshot support for CephFS backend. Following that deprecation
in Manila, the corresponding parameter of puppet-manila was deprecated
during the Victoria cycle [2] and it is being removed during the Xena
cycle.

This deprecates the corresponding parameter from tripleo-heat-tempaltes
because it has no effect since Wallaby.

[1] 2d7c46445396b0db780ba456ffb9284b177a6ae4
[2] 2388d7510d600e358c76becf13d08581b489f2a7

NOTE(stable/wallaby):
  The backport dealt with conflicts due to the changes in
  deployment/manila/manila-backend-cephfs.yaml that were introduced in xena:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/816737

  This deprecation change should be backported in order to introduce
  these deprecation removal changes:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/839358

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I81565290603eb60c8c18e64c95ead7b761e8cb78
(cherry picked from commit e0cb3c62764dbec7bccb5148a04c82547334afab)

commit_message:
Replace distutils with packaging in 3rd party drivers

PEP632 defines the deprecation of `distutils` from Python 3.10
and complete removal from Python 3.12.

This patch preempts any future issues and follows the long
standing recommendation to replace distutils with setuptools
(packaging in the case of version string checking)

Change-Id: Ie455f3f32a0681d2d7eb54344f9186d09d3de80f

commit_message:
Add support for Pure Storage FlashArray backend to Cinder

Add an enable_cinder_backend_pure_iscsi and
enable_cinder_backend_pure_fc options to etc/kolla/globals.yml
to enable use of the FlashArray backend.
Update the documentation to include a section on configuring
Cinder with the FlashArray.

Implements: blueprint pure-cinder-driver
Change-Id: I464733f1322237321ed1ffff8636cf30bd1cbb38

commit_message:
Fix standby node regex for check_crm

Pacemaker has changed the output format of crm_mon and this broke
the regex to catch nodes that are on standby mode. This change
updates the regex for not alerting on paused units.

Change-Id: I137acad076bff58506fea6e1618a00765adacd9b
Closes-Bug: #1971182
Related-Bug: #1880576
(cherry picked from commit a0b419519cd438affb24ff80c0221cc33d884c9a)

subject: Prevent errors when private-address=None
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-12 13:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_utils.py'], 'message': 'Prevent errors when private-address=None

Whenever a peer returns None as its IP, it results in
misconfiguration in corosync.conf, which results in
a series of cascading hook errors that are difficult to
sort out.

More specifically, this usually happens when network-get
does not work for the current binding. The main problem
is that when changing bindings, a hook fires before the
network-get data is updated. This hook fails and prevents
the network-get from being re-read.

This patch changes the code behavior to ignore None IP
entries, therefore gracefully exiting and deferring further
configuration due to insufficient number of peers when that
happens, so that a later hook can successfully read the IP
from the relation and set the IPs correctly in corosync.

Closes-bug: #1961448
Change-Id: I5ed140a17e184fcf6954d0f66e25f74564bd281c
(cherry picked from commit d54de3d3464352ca07e4b9d9f6a5c8350464b29b)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Prevent errors when private-address=None

Whenever a peer returns None as its IP, it results in
misconfiguration in corosync.conf, which results in
a series of cascading hook errors that are difficult to
sort out.

More specifically, this usually happens when network-get
does not work for the current binding. The main problem
is that when changing bindings, a hook fires before the
network-get data is updated. This hook fails and prevents
the network-get from being re-read.

This patch changes the code behavior to ignore None IP
entries, therefore gracefully exiting and deferring further
configuration due to insufficient number of peers when that
happens, so that a later hook can successfully read the IP
from the relation and set the IPs correctly in corosync.

Closes-bug: #1961448
Change-Id: I5ed140a17e184fcf6954d0f66e25f74564bd281c
(cherry picked from commit d54de3d3464352ca07e4b9d9f6a5c8350464b29b)

subject: Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-12 13:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'templates/corosync.conf', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_hooks.py'], 'message': "Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install

Starting in focal, the ubuntu version of corosync package synced in from
debian includes node1 as the default name for the local node with a nodeid
of 1. This causes the cluster to have knowledge of this extra node1 node,
which affects quorum, etc. Installing the charm's corosync.conf file
before package installation prevents this conditioning from happening.

Additionally this change removes some Xenial bits in the charm and always
includes a nodelist in corosync.conf as it is compulsory in focal and
newer. It is optional in the bionic packages, so we'll always just
render the nodelist.

Change-Id: I06b9c23eb57274f0c99a3a05979c0cabf87c8118
Closes-Bug: #1874719
(cherry picked from commit d1191dbcabdfd8684a86825f06c6ede266ba93ba)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install

Starting in focal, the ubuntu version of corosync package synced in from
debian includes node1 as the default name for the local node with a nodeid
of 1. This causes the cluster to have knowledge of this extra node1 node,
which affects quorum, etc. Installing the charm's corosync.conf file
before package installation prevents this conditioning from happening.

Additionally this change removes some Xenial bits in the charm and always
includes a nodelist in corosync.conf as it is compulsory in focal and
newer. It is optional in the bionic packages, so we'll always just
render the nodelist.

Change-Id: I06b9c23eb57274f0c99a3a05979c0cabf87c8118
Closes-Bug: #1874719
(cherry picked from commit d1191dbcabdfd8684a86825f06c6ede266ba93ba)

The charm attempts to bootstrap OSDs on both the mon-relation-changed
and the mon-relation-departed hooks. There is no logical reason that

Closes-Bug: #1885195
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't bootstrap osds on mon-relation-departed hook

The charm attempts to bootstrap OSDs on both the mon-relation-changed
and the mon-relation-departed hooks. There is no logical reason that
the OSDs should be bootstrapped in the -departed hook.

Change-Id: I79a790291b0e361d2748d6bed8c989d16ad36daf
Closes-Bug: #1885195

Related-Bug: #1929446
Change-Id: Ibd3c7427cbcab81253e0ed700174be09908bdef7
(cherry picked from commit a2d3ef2a6491eb63b5ee961fc930070207a79d84)

commit_message:
Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl

On python-ovs 2.16.0+, overriding cooperative_yield() will allow
potentially long-running CPU-intensive methods to cooperatively
yield to greenthreads. This patch + ovs 2.16.0+ will resolve
the related bug. I'll see if I can get cooperative_yield
backported in OVS as well.

Related-Bug: #1929446
Change-Id: Ibd3c7427cbcab81253e0ed700174be09908bdef7
(cherry picked from commit a2d3ef2a6491eb63b5ee961fc930070207a79d84)

commit_message:
placement-status: check only consumers in allocation table

Initially, _check_incomplete_consumers was intended to find the case
when consumers are mentioned in allocation but do not exist in the
consumer table. Due to a bug it's possible to have rows in the
consumer table those are not in the allocation table. The second case
it seems was not expected and it can be tricky to automate a cleanup
with zero touch upgrade.

This patch modifies the check such way it counts only consumers
presented in the allocation table.

Conflicts:
    placement/cmd/status.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
Ie0bee79c1ee185c0f68fa170c668395d9058c56d (Fix SQL query counting the
number of individual consumers having allocations by only selecting the
aggregated consumer_id column.) is not in Wallaby.

Related-bug: #1780799
Change-Id: I569043dd9f1c964faf7d4fcbb901a93f9569bf3d
(cherry picked from commit 3253e2efc05836b0b5cefafbf2b2656e9e1a50c7)
(cherry picked from commit 7f66845b6382513ae291914ea02787e9776505a0)
(cherry picked from commit 93bd7f23ad6e993185e32f038db90bb81e8746e2)

commit_message:
placement-status: check only consumers in allocation table

Initially, _check_incomplete_consumers was intended to find the case
when consumers are mentioned in allocation but do not exist in the
consumer table. Due to a bug it's possible to have rows in the
consumer table those are not in the allocation table. The second case
it seems was not expected and it can be tricky to automate a cleanup
with zero touch upgrade.

This patch modifies the check such way it counts only consumers
presented in the allocation table.

Conflicts:
    placement/cmd/status.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
Ie0bee79c1ee185c0f68fa170c668395d9058c56d (Fix SQL query counting the
number of individual consumers having allocations by only selecting the
aggregated consumer_id column.) is not in Wallaby.

Related-bug: #1780799
Change-Id: I569043dd9f1c964faf7d4fcbb901a93f9569bf3d
(cherry picked from commit 3253e2efc05836b0b5cefafbf2b2656e9e1a50c7)
(cherry picked from commit 7f66845b6382513ae291914ea02787e9776505a0)

commit_message:
Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl

On python-ovs 2.16.0+, overriding cooperative_yield() will allow
potentially long-running CPU-intensive methods to cooperatively
yield to greenthreads. This patch + ovs 2.16.0+ will resolve
the related bug. I'll see if I can get cooperative_yield
backported in OVS as well.

Related-Bug: #1929446
Change-Id: Ibd3c7427cbcab81253e0ed700174be09908bdef7
(cherry picked from commit a2d3ef2a6491eb63b5ee961fc930070207a79d84)

[{'created': '2021-10-13 21:36:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Ironic - Handle instance host on rebalance

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2021-11-03 15:05:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Ironic - Handle instance host on rebalance

Change-Id: I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2021-11-03 17:56:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Ironic - Handle instance host on rebalance

Change-Id: I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2021-11-10 18:17:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ironic - Handle instance host on rebalance

Nova-compute services supporting the pass-through to Ironic
utilize a hash ring to handle "who is responsible" for a given
compute node. This allows for load to be spread across a number
of nova-computes, and parallel updates/tracking to take place,
which is commonly very necessary in the Bare Metal as a Service
(BMaaS) use case as operators typically run the nova-compute service
on their control plane and the underlying resource availability is
not limited to a single host.

However, when an instance is deployed, and the compute node has
rebalanced, the user looses the ability to trigger actions on nodes
previously managed by an offline nova-compute instance. This is
because the call to perform the instance action is routed to the
instance's host record across the RPC bus.

What we explicitly need to do is when we rebalance, we need to
reconcile the host record entries to parallel who is actively
managing the node based upon the hash ring.

This requires us to know when the hash ring has changed,
and then efficently handle:

* If we should manage the node because the hash ring says so.
* If that node is the same compute node we're on, then nothing to
  see here, carry on.
* If the hash ring is indicating the node is managed by *us* and
  the prior host is online, then do *nothing*. The requests can still
  be handled, and allow that node to continue to manage requests the
  instance. This may also just be an additional rebalance is inbound,
  we *really* don't have a good way of knowing so, so logically it is
  just best to also just hold off.
* If all else fails, as in the compute service/host is missing or has
  been removed, then force the instance's host to be the current
  running compute host which the hash ring indicates should manage
  the instance.

All reconcilliation is also performed using ironic's knowledge of the
instance as well. Obviously, if there is no instance, no action is
required and the node cache being reported can be updated with that
node. If an instance is unknown to nova-compute, then we tolerate
that as there may be more than one nova in the same ironic sandbox.

This change in behavior, necessitates a change in the node cache
pattern. Previously, if an instance was already running on a node,
we wouldn't add it to cache of nodes being managed unless it matched
to the current compute host against the instance's host record.

This selective caching previously had an impact of the node
disappearing from nova's view because we would only consider
caching of nodes which have *not* been allocated for use even
if the hash ring indicates we are the responsible nova-compute
process.

The previous resulitng disappearance from view creates additional
unexpected conditions because resource tracking calls thorugh
get_available_resource and node_is_available calls ultimately
leverage the cache of nodes to be managed by the compute service
instance running, and a lack of presence in the cache can result
in the node being considered disabled and being entirely skipped
from resource tracker runs *and* ultimately causes the compute
node entry to be destroyed and removed from the resource tracker.

In other words, since the hash ring dictates we manage the node,
Then we must be capable of doing so accordingly.

This patch does *not* update the compute node host field record,
which is queried and intertwined with cases where a compute node
be deleted. For reviewer sanity, that will be done in another patch,
which is related to launchpad bug #1825876.

Closes-Bug: #1730834
Closes: rhbz#2017980
Related: #1825876
Change-Id: I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2021-11-24 18:08:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Ironic - Handle instance/node host on rebalance

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2022-02-16 21:24:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Ironic - Handle instance/node host on rebalance

Nova-compute services supporting the pass-through to Ironic
utilize a hash ring to handle "who is responsible" for a given
compute node. This allows for load to be spread across a number
of nova-computes, and parallel updates/tracking to take place,
which is commonly very necessary in the Bare Metal as a Service
(BMaaS) use case as operators typically run the nova-compute service
on their control plane and the underlying resource availability is
not limited to a single host.

However, when an instance is deployed, and the compute node has
rebalanced, the user looses the ability to trigger actions on nodes
previously managed by an offline nova-compute instance. This is
because the call to perform the instance action is routed to the
instance's host record across the RPC bus.

What we explicitly need to do is when we rebalance, we need to
reconcile the host record entries to reflect who is actively
managing the node based upon the hash ring.

This requires us to know when the hash ring has changed,
and then efficently handle:

* If we should manage the node because the hash ring says so.
* If the ironic node is managed by the compute service node we
  are operating on, then nothing to see here, carry on.
* If the hash ring is indicating the node is managed by *us* and
  the prior host is online, then do *nothing*. The requests can still
  be handled, and allow that node to continue to manage requests the
  instance. This may be an indication an additional rebalance is
  impending, we *really* don't have a good way of knowing so bececause
  of the number of operational variables, so logically it is just best
  to also just hold off and let things hopefully stablize.
* If all else fails, as in the compute service/host is missing or has
  been removed, then force the instance's host and compute node service
  entry to be the current running compute host which the hash ring
  indicates should manage interaction of the baremetal node on behalf
  of Nova.

All reconcilliation is also performed using ironic's state knowledge
as well. Obviously, if there is no instance, no action is
required and the node cache being reported can be updated with that
node. If an instance is unknown to nova-compute, then we tolerate
that as there may be more than one nova in the same ironic sandbox.
Doing so has an added benefit of allowing recovery from someone
accidently changing the peer list/conductor group, and thus changing
the view the nova-compute service is able to view. The reconcillation
will fix the host field entries accordingly.

This change in behavior, necessitates a change in the node cache
pattern. Previously, if an instance was already running on a node,
we wouldn't add it to cache of nodes being managed unless it matched
to the current compute host against the instance's host record.

This selective caching previously had an impact of the node
disappearing from nova's view because we would only consider
caching of nodes which have *not* been allocated for use even
if the hash ring indicates we are the responsible nova-compute
process.

The previous resulting disappearance from view creates additional
unexpected conditions because resource tracking calls thorugh
get_available_resource and node_is_available calls ultimately
leverage the cache of nodes to be managed by the compute service
instance running, and a lack of presence in the cache can result
in the node being considered disabled and being entirely skipped
from resource tracker runs *and* ultimately causes the compute
node entry to be destroyed and removed from the resource tracker,
orphaning the ability to manage the instance. Reconciling, now
ultimatley enables the continued management of the instance as well.

In other words, since the hash ring dictates we manage the node,
Then we must be capable of doing so accordingly and not setup
ourselves for orphaned compute node and instance entries creating
operator headaches which presently require manual database edits
to remedy.

This patch is by no means perfect. It focuses on eventual
consistency and balancing impact versus operational performance,
also while intending to be able to be backported in order to help
address so many different interaction issues between Nova and
Ironic.

It must be highlighted these prior issues are related to
I39241223b447fcc671161c370dbf16e1773b684a, which was ultimately
caused by the fact compute node host mappings can be orphaned under
nova.virt.ironic's prior behavior. This patch doesn't completely
prevent that from still being the case, but should help substantially,
again, not perfect, but a hopefully balanced operational improvement.

Closes-Bug: #1730834
Closes-Bug: #1825876
Closes: rhbz#2017980
Closes-Bug: #1825876
Related: #1853009
Change-Id: I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0

commit_message:
Ironic - Handle instance/node host on rebalance

Nova-compute services supporting the pass-through to Ironic
utilize a hash ring to handle "who is responsible" for a given
compute node. This allows for load to be spread across a number
of nova-computes, and parallel updates/tracking to take place,
which is commonly very necessary in the Bare Metal as a Service
(BMaaS) use case as operators typically run the nova-compute service
on their control plane and the underlying resource availability is
not limited to a single host.

However, when an instance is deployed, and the compute node has
rebalanced, the user looses the ability to trigger actions on nodes
previously managed by an offline nova-compute instance. This is
because the call to perform the instance action is routed to the
instance's host record across the RPC bus.

What we explicitly need to do is when we rebalance, we need to
reconcile the host record entries to reflect who is actively
managing the node based upon the hash ring.

This requires us to know when the hash ring has changed,
and then efficently handle:

* If we should manage the node because the hash ring says so.
* If the ironic node is managed by the compute service node we
  are operating on, then nothing to see here, carry on.
* If the hash ring is indicating the node is managed by *us* and
  the prior host is online, then do *nothing*. The requests can still
  be handled, and allow that node to continue to manage requests the
  instance. This may be an indication an additional rebalance is
  impending, we *really* don't have a good way of knowing so bececause
  of the number of operational variables, so logically it is just best
  to also just hold off and let things hopefully stablize.
* If all else fails, as in the compute service/host is missing or has
  been removed, then force the instance's host and compute node service
  entry to be the current running compute host which the hash ring
  indicates should manage interaction of the baremetal node on behalf
  of Nova.

All reconcilliation is also performed using ironic's state knowledge
as well. Obviously, if there is no instance, no action is
required and the node cache being reported can be updated with that
node. If an instance is unknown to nova-compute, then we tolerate
that as there may be more than one nova in the same ironic sandbox.
Doing so has an added benefit of allowing recovery from someone
accidently changing the peer list/conductor group, and thus changing
the view the nova-compute service is able to view. The reconcillation
will fix the host field entries accordingly.

This change in behavior, necessitates a change in the node cache
pattern. Previously, if an instance was already running on a node,
we wouldn't add it to cache of nodes being managed unless it matched
to the current compute host against the instance's host record.

This selective caching previously had an impact of the node
disappearing from nova's view because we would only consider
caching of nodes which have *not* been allocated for use even
if the hash ring indicates we are the responsible nova-compute
process.

The previous resulting disappearance from view creates additional
unexpected conditions because resource tracking calls thorugh
get_available_resource and node_is_available calls ultimately
leverage the cache of nodes to be managed by the compute service
instance running, and a lack of presence in the cache can result
in the node being considered disabled and being entirely skipped
from resource tracker runs *and* ultimately causes the compute
node entry to be destroyed and removed from the resource tracker,
orphaning the ability to manage the instance. Reconciling, now
ultimatley enables the continued management of the instance as well.

In other words, since the hash ring dictates we manage the node,
Then we must be capable of doing so accordingly and not setup
ourselves for orphaned compute node and instance entries creating
operator headaches which presently require manual database edits
to remedy.

This patch is by no means perfect. It focuses on eventual
consistency and balancing impact versus operational performance,
also while intending to be able to be backported in order to help
address so many different interaction issues between Nova and
Ironic.

It must be highlighted these prior issues are related to
I39241223b447fcc671161c370dbf16e1773b684a, which was ultimately
caused by the fact compute node host mappings can be orphaned under
nova.virt.ironic's prior behavior. This patch doesn't completely
prevent that from still being the case, but should help substantially,
again, not perfect, but a hopefully balanced operational improvement.

Closes-Bug: #1730834
Closes-Bug: #1825876
Closes: rhbz#2017980
Closes-Bug: #1825876
Related: #1853009
Change-Id: I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0

commit_message:
Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl

On python-ovs 2.16.0+, overriding cooperative_yield() will allow
potentially long-running CPU-intensive methods to cooperatively
yield to greenthreads. This patch + ovs 2.16.0+ will resolve
the related bug. I'll see if I can get cooperative_yield
backported in OVS as well.

Related-Bug: #1929446
Change-Id: Ibd3c7427cbcab81253e0ed700174be09908bdef7
(cherry picked from commit a2d3ef2a6491eb63b5ee961fc930070207a79d84)

commit_message:
Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl

On python-ovs 2.16.0+, overriding cooperative_yield() will allow
potentially long-running CPU-intensive methods to cooperatively
yield to greenthreads. This patch + ovs 2.16.0+ will resolve
the related bug. I'll see if I can get cooperative_yield
backported in OVS as well.

Related-Bug: #1929446
Change-Id: Ibd3c7427cbcab81253e0ed700174be09908bdef7
(cherry picked from commit a2d3ef2a6491eb63b5ee961fc930070207a79d84)

Drop install_venv

install_venv is a legacy and not used in our CI,so drop it completely.

commit_message:
Comment out ssh code in use-it script

With the move to using Ubuntu 20.04, the current way that
we test openstack with the use-it script does not seem
to work correctly. While we come up with a better solution,
this change comments out the ssh related functions.

Change-Id: I57caf7fbd0d95db778ce66b2b05f3bd8a346bcd8

commit_message:
Prevent the enroll/deploy commands from running without venv

Running them without sourcing the venv configuration results in a very
confusing error message from ansible. Prevent that.

Change-Id: I0cc408b475134eb76d3229b9cccefb9555b4bcba

commit_message:
Manila: Deprecate ineffctive *DriverHandlesShareServers

In puppet-manila, the driver_handlers_share_servers parameter have been
deprecated for some backends[1] because these backends can only accept
true or false and accpepting arbitrary value results in manila service
failing to start.
This change deprecate the corresponding parameters in template files so
that we can remove usage of these deprecated parameters.

[1] 4c365c9064845e73a1da0f868ebba5a00c6a5c7a

NOTE(stable/wallaby):
  The backport dealt with conflicts due to the changes in
   - deployment/manila/manila-backend-isilon.yaml
   - deployment/manila/manila-backend-vmax.yaml
   - deployment/manila/manila-backend-vnx.yaml
  that were introduced in xena:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/816737

  This deprecation change should be backported in order to introduce
  these deprecation removal changes:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/839358

Change-Id: I7cd02aa0f107e74ec35be3d1928d7aa661885d40
(cherry picked from commit 8a7201cd055a14769c60267077c467011633f7ae)

commit_message:
Stop generating certificate requests for disabled networks

The certificate requests created based on ApacheNetworks require fqdn_NETWORK to be set.
The will only be defined for the networks that are enabled for the current role.

Currently requests are generated for all networks. This happens to work for the Controller role
as all networks are enabled. However it fails on DCN compute nodes that are not on the external
network (they use apache for local glance-api services).

Change-Id: I05ba5fb48c617a5bbedebb8b74c23bec9abf3bbd
